title: Arugula, Roasted Tomato, and Goat Cheese Salad
summary: Arugula, Roasted Tomato, and Goat Cheese Salad might be just the side dish you are searching for. One serving contains 61 calories, 2g of protein, and 1g of fat. This recipe serves 6. For $1.01 per serving, this recipe covers 5% of your daily requirements of vitamins and minerals. 1 person has made this recipe and would make it again. If you have thinly onion, pepper, maple-balsamic dressing, and a few other ingredients on hand, you can make it. From preparation to the plate, this recipe takes approximately 45 minutes. It is a good option if you're following a gluten free, primal, and vegetarian diet. All things considered, we decided this recipe deserves a spoonacular score of 47%. This score is good. Try Creamy Arugula Pasta Salad with Goat Cheese and Tomato, Roasted Beet Salad With Goat Cheese And Arugula, and Roasted Beet and Arugula Salad with Pistachios and Goat Cheese for similar recipes.
instructions: Preheat oven to 350.                                                                                                Combine the tomatoes and 2 tablespoons Maple-Balsamic Dressing; toss well to coat. Arrange tomatoes, cut sides up, on a jelly-roll pan coated with cooking spray. Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tomatoes soften. Cool completely.                                                                                                Combine tomatoes, baby arugula, and onion in a large bowl. Drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons Maple-Balsamic Dressing; toss gently to coat. Sprinkle evenly with cheese and pepper.

steps.step: Combine the tomatoes and 2 tablespoons Maple-Balsamic Dressing; toss well to coat. Arrange tomatoes, cut sides up, on a jelly-roll pan coated with cooking spray.
Bake at 350 for 30 minutes or until tomatoes soften. Cool completely.
Combine tomatoes, baby arugula, and onion in a large bowl.
Drizzle with the remaining 2 tablespoons Maple-Balsamic Dressing; toss gently to coat.
Sprinkle evenly with cheese and pepper.
